data.title: Why did Jane leave EastEnders and what happened to her?
data.meta_description: Find out who Bobby Beale's mum is and the details about stepmum Jane Beale. What happened to her in EastEnders, and is she sticking around?
data.text:
Bobby Beale (Clay Milner Russell) has had a dark history in EastEnders including a spell in prison for killing his sister Lucy (Hetti Bywater).

In recent years we’ve seen him come head to head with a number of residents, including Lucy’s mum Cindy Beale (Michelle Collins), who don’t have faith he can change.

We’ve also seen him struggle in the last week as his 21st birthday approaches – a milestone that Lucy never got to celebrate.

Things are also a little rocky between Bobby and girlfriend Anna Knight (Molly Rainford), with him unable to bond with her beloved pooch Tyson. With her old flame Freddie Slater (Bobby Brazier) back on the scene, it looks likely that feelings could soon resurface…

To make matters worse for Bobby, his former step-mum Jane Beale (Laurie Brett) then arrived back on the scene, the woman who raised him and helped to conceal Lucy’s murder.

Here, find out who Bobby’s birth mother was, why step-mum Jane returned to Albert Square, and if she’ll be staying for long…

Who is Bobby Beale’s mum?

Bobby Beale is the son of Ian Beale (Adam Woodyatt) and Laura Beale (Hannah Waterman), although there was initially drama surrounding the identity of his father.

Laura had originally thought that Garry Hobbs (Ricky Groves) was Bobby’s dad, but it was later revealed that Garry had the wrong blood group and that Ian was the rightful father.

Ian initially avoided caring for Bobby, letting Garry look after him while unaware that he was not really his son.

Laura then died in April 2004 after tripping on Bobby’s toys and falling down the stairs.

After her death, the truth about Bobby’s real father came out when Pat Evans (Pam St Clement) discovered his birth certificate.

Jane Beale was close to Bobby and acted as his adoptive mother for a portion of his childhood while she was married to Ian.

She had discovered Lucy Beale’s body after Bobby had killed her, and she had initially protected him by moving the body and convincing him that he hadn’t killed her.

Bobby later attacked Jane by hitting her on the head and legs with a hockey stick, before being sentenced to four years in prison.

Why did Jane return to EastEnders?

Jane Beale contacted Ian again hoping to reconnect with Bobby ahead of his birthday.

The ordeal was emotional for Jane, as expected. At first, Bobby struggled to warm to his mum because he couldn’t understand why Jane had forgiven him for the ordeal surrounding Lucy’s murder, let alone attacking and paralysing her with a hockey stick.

Jane explained that she’s able to move past everything because Bobby is her son and she loves him unconditionally. As they chatted about forgiveness, Bobby broke down and Jane was able to comfort him.

A little while later, prior to Bobby leaving, he was gifted an early birthday present by Jane. He opened the box to find a silver band with The Verse of Ayatul Kursi engraved on it – a powerful piece of text from the Quran.

When Bobby, Peter (Thomas Law) and Ian arrived back in Albert Square, Jane was then seen on the phone to former character Masood (Nitin Ganatra).

It was confirmed Jane and Masood are in a relationship, and that Masood had helped Jane with Bobby’s birthday present.

Has Jane left EastEnders?

It was a flying visit for Jane Beale this time round, as we know she has left the BBC One soap.

‘I was quite nervous on the first day, thinking, “Gosh, do I remember how to be Jane?” But even though I was nervous, I’d had quite a lot of time to think about it, having had the scripts for a while, so it was just about getting back into the swing of it’, Laurie said.

‘When I walked on set and saw Adam (Woodyatt) and Michelle (Collins), and also our director Karl Neilson, who directed the live episode in 2015, plus loads of the crew that I knew, all my worries melted away.

‘There were so many familiar faces who were so welcoming. So, about half an hour in, it was like I’d never been away.’

Her return has more than likely impacted the upcoming departure of Clay Milner Russell as Bobby – and intense filming pictures showed a graveside showdown between him and Cindy.

Prior to this, Jane was last seen in Albert Square back in 2017. She ran away from her home after being confronted by Max Branning (Jake Wood), who had tried to get revenge on just about everyone after time in prison for Lucy’s murder.

As part of the plot, Max set fire to the local restaurant which very nearly resulted in Jane being killed. When she woke up in hospital, she eventually agreed to a deal with Max that would involve her fleeing Walford and keeping quiet about what he had done.

This article was originally published on 25th June 2019.
